{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3312667,"name":"JohnD 3322","username":"JohnD","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/58f4c7/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-19T02:57:09.425Z","cooked":"

Our Driver Station Data Log is not showing current readings from the PDH on our competition robot. It’s working fine on our practice bot with mostly identical code, so I’m suspecting the PDH may be bad. Is there a setting somewhere to disable current logging?

A search shows a few threads on this topic for the PDB 10+ years ago and that pointed to a firmware issue at the time.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-19T02:57:40.094Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":150,"reads":193,"readers_count":192,"score":788.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":455272,"topic_slug":"pdh-not-logging-currents","display_username":"JohnD 3322","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29618,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pdh-not-logging-currents/455272/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3312672,"name":"Tanner Sommers","username":"Sticks","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sticks/{size}/214857_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-19T02:58:13.818Z","cooked":"

What are you using to log the PDH values? It could be something wrong with your code, or maybe the firmware version like you mentioned. Is it up to date? Have you tried restarting the DS?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-19T02:58:13.818Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":192,"readers_count":191,"score":43.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":455272,"topic_slug":"pdh-not-logging-currents","display_username":"Tanner Sommers","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64119,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pdh-not-logging-currents/455272/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3312682,"name":"JohnD 3322","username":"JohnD","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/58f4c7/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-19T03:06:53.434Z","cooked":"

Yes, the PDH is up to date (23.0.0 if I remember correctly). What code is needed for the DS to access the PDH? This isn’t something we’ve seen before, so maybe it is something out of boilerplate code that accidentally got deleted?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-19T03:06:53.434Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":184,"readers_count":183,"score":46.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":455272,"topic_slug":"pdh-not-logging-currents","display_username":"JohnD 3322","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64119,"username":"Sticks","name":"Tanner Sommers","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sticks/{size}/214857_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29618,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pdh-not-logging-currents/455272/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3312683,"name":"Tanner Sommers","username":"Sticks","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sticks/{size}/214857_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-19T03:07:38.728Z","cooked":"

It’s possible. Can you show me the code that you use to get at the PDH and read its values?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-19T03:07:38.728Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":171,"readers_count":170,"score":39.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":455272,"topic_slug":"pdh-not-logging-currents","display_username":"Tanner Sommers","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":29618,"username":"JohnD","name":"JohnD 3322","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/58f4c7/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64119,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pdh-not-logging-currents/455272/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3312685,"name":"JohnD 3322","username":"JohnD","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/58f4c7/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-19T03:10:07.234Z","cooked":"

Maybe tomorrow. Like I say, it isn’t code we normally work with. I’m going to have a programmer instantiate the PDH object tomorrow and display a current to see if we can see a non-zero value. Here’s the page describing the code we’ll be adding to test this.

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Power Distribution Module

The CTRE Power Distribution Panel ( PDP) and Rev Power Distribution Hub ( PDH) can use their CAN connectivity to communicate a wealth of status information regarding the robot’s power use to the ro...

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-19T03:10:07.234Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":164,"readers_count":163,"score":47.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":455272,"topic_slug":"pdh-not-logging-currents","display_username":"JohnD 3322","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/can-devices/power-distribution-module.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Power Distribution Module — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":15}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64119,"username":"Sticks","name":"Tanner Sommers","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sticks/{size}/214857_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29618,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pdh-not-logging-currents/455272/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3312687,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-19T03:11:50.416Z","cooked":"

What is the CAN ID of your PDH?

I’ve tried this with the standard log viewer and the V2.2 reader and they both show nothing. Not even zero values… I haven’t dug into the binary log file yet to see if the data is there or not (hoping to not have to go down that path).

PDH is properly set at ID 1

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-19T03:12:45.368Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":147,"readers_count":146,"score":39.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":455272,"topic_slug":"pdh-not-logging-currents","display_username":"JohnD 3322","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":65,"username":"Joe_Ross","name":"Joe Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29618,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pdh-not-logging-currents/455272/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3312696,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-19T03:16:54.116Z","cooked":"

Perhaps a dumb question, but can you confirm the PDH is connected via CAN and properly (i.e. no yellow<->green flips)?

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-19T03:22:49.299Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":147,"readers_count":146,"score":29.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":455272,"topic_slug":"pdh-not-logging-currents","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":29618,"username":"JohnD","name":"JohnD 3322","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/58f4c7/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/pdh-not-logging-currents/455272/9","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3312758,"name":"JohnRRRR","username":"JohnRRRR","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/94ad74/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-19T05:12:28.895Z","cooked":"

The rev hardware client will show current readings while you are troubleshooting the logging issue. Double check CAN wiring and termination switch.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-19T05:12:28.895Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":134,"readers_count":133,"score":36.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":455272,"topic_slug":"pdh-not-logging-currents","display_username":"JohnRRRR","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27328,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pdh-not-logging-currents/455272/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3313016,"name":"JohnD 3322","username":"JohnD","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/58f4c7/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-19T17:46:29.706Z","cooked":"

that’s what is leaning me toward faulty hardware. Even when connected to the PDH via USB-C RevHC still shows all zeros for the current readings. I assume I should see some minimum current on the channels (especially Roborio power port).

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-19T17:46:29.706Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":108,"readers_count":107,"score":26.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":455272,"topic_slug":"pdh-not-logging-currents","display_username":"JohnD 3322","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":27328,"username":"JohnRRRR","name":"JohnRRRR","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/94ad74/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29618,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pdh-not-logging-currents/455272/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3313159,"name":"Gavin Matthews","username":"bovlb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-19T21:51:26.568Z","cooked":"

When you look at the Diagnostics Tab on the Driver Station, does it list a version number for the PDH?

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-19T21:51:26.568Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":96,"readers_count":95,"score":29.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":455272,"topic_slug":"pdh-not-logging-currents","display_username":"Gavin Matthews","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/driverstation/driver-station.html#diagnostics-tab","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"FRC Driver Station Powered by NI LabVIEW — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38743,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)"},"post_url":"/t/pdh-not-logging-currents/455272/12","custom_user_title":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3313277,"name":"JohnD 3322","username":"JohnD","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/58f4c7/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-20T00:46:01.366Z","cooked":"

The plot thickens. I do see proper termination near 60 ohms (57.8) on the CAN bus. The coloring is correct (yellow to yellow, green to green - thanks Fletch137, always good to start with the basics). That implies the connections to the PDH are good (at 0 Hz, DC).

I do not see:

  • The PDH version on the Diagnostics page (thanks bovlb!)
  • The PDH on the CAN bus in RevHC from a SparkMax near the Roborio (far end of the CAN bus).
  • The PDH on the CAN bus in RevHC from the SparkMax closest to the PDH on the CAN bus (about 10" away).

So either:

  • Bad PDH (FW version is V23.0.0 when I connect to the USB-C on the PDH).
  • Transmission line issue (at 1 MHz+) on the CAN bus (there are 19 devices on the bus so we are getting longish). All other devices are communicating properly though, and the SM 10" away should have found the PDH.

More debugging…

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-20T00:46:01.366Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":81,"readers_count":80,"score":21.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":455272,"topic_slug":"pdh-not-logging-currents","display_username":"JohnD 3322","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29618,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pdh-not-logging-currents/455272/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3313287,"name":"Gavin Matthews","username":"bovlb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-20T01:06:36.141Z","cooked":"

If the roboRIO can talk to the last SparkMax, but not the PDH, that suggests to me, either that there’s a problem with the CAN bus wiring between the last SparkMax and the PDH, or there is a problem with the PDH. Have you checked the PDH status lights?

Ah, status lights, buried in the robot… The PDH status is blinking orange/magenta indicating ‘device overcurrent’. Anyone know which device? Is there a fix or does this mean the PDH needs to be replaced?

Here are a couple of threads that might be useful:

4795 Eastbots - 2024 Build Thread Open Alliance
Build season update 2/18: Hard stop We decided that the travel of the gas shock is not sufficient to act as a hardstop, so we added hardstop at the front of the robot. It is also used as the limelight+radio mount for now. The purple part is printed out of TPU to absorb shock. [image] PDH issues During testing, our CAN bus ceased receiving traffic, which was traced to the PDH displaying a “Device Overcurrent” blink code and reporting CAN errors on the REV HW client. Despite multiple reboots, e…
REV PDH Error Electrical
My team has been experiencing issues with the new REV Power Distribution Hubs. It all started when I tried to access the CAN Network using the USB-C connection in the REV Hardware Client. I could see all the devices in the CAN network, but the Client told me the REV devices needed updates. When I tried to update them, the update failed, so I looked at the signal lights for the PDH. It looked like they were blinking orange and magenta which would suggest a Device Over Current error (according to …
docs.revrobotics.com

Power Distribution Hub Troubleshooting

I think you are at or near the point of contacting Rev for support.

To follow up, I realized this PDH is showing 100% CAN bus errors (you can see that in Rev Hardware Client when you click on the CAN-bus) while a SparkMax on the same bus reports zero errors. Working with Rev it also won’t downgrade the firmware back to v22.0.3, so I expect this PDH is going back for repair. We swapped it off the robot.
